meanings.definition: The skill or art of steering a ship or boat.
meanings.sent1: His helmsmanship was evident as he expertly guided the boat through the rough waters.
meanings.sent2: The captain's helmsmanship ensured the ship stayed on course during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The sailor's helmsmanship was so good, he could probably steer a bathtub!
meanings.sent4: Her helmsmanship was like a steady hand guiding the ship through life's unpredictable seas.
meanings.sent5: The helmsmanship of the old sea captain was legendary, whispered about by sailors in every port.

meanings.definition: The ability to lead or guide a group or organization effectively.
meanings.sent1: The CEO's helmsmanship was crucial in steering the company towards success.
meanings.sent2: She demonstrated exceptional helmsmanship in managing the team through the project.
meanings.sent3: His helmsmanship was so good, he could probably lead a group of penguins on a mission!
meanings.sent4: Her helmsmanship was like a beacon of light guiding the organization through turbulent times.
meanings.sent5: The helmsmanship of the teacher kept the classroom running smoothly, like a well-oiled machine.
